articles.title: Girl’s tooth found in Laos cave could be first ancient fossil of its kind in Southeast Asia - 7NEWS
articles.description: The girl was likely a Denisovan, a group from over 130,000 years ago which once mated with Homo sapiens - their DNA still lives on in some humans today.
articles.content:
A tooth unearthed from a remote cave in Laos is helping to sketch an unknown chapter in the human story.
